lexUnit.name: shock.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: cause (someone) to feel surprised and upset

sentence.text: We do n't want to shock that good woman 's tender susceptibilities , do we ?
Her policy often shocks airline stewardesses because the singer wo n't touch artificial food containers .
Yesterday , speaking exclusively to TODAY , Mandy revealed how shocked she was by Wyman 's decision to speak about his marriage break-up .
I drank again , scalding my throat to shock me awake .
It shocked her that she could make such a cool analysis of the situation .
The sound of the door opening and of voices as people came out on to the deck shocked her so much that she felt physically sick .
` Well , it 's shocked me that President Bush has gone out and ballyhooed the unions in Poland and yet he 's turned his back on us . "
It had shocked him to discover , while a student , that at least half the men in his year had had no love or emotional experience at all .
It still shocks you to see them -- that 's where they put the people to work .
She shocked the world with a short-lived marriage to Frank Sinatra , 30 years her senior .
` Shall I shock you more with another truth ?
Entering St Petersburg Conservatory at 13 , he shocked his professors with his angular harmonies , jagged rhythms and plangent colours .
AUSTRIA 'S three-time World Cup winner and Olympic skiing champion Petra Kronberger , 23 , yesterday shocked the sport with the announcement of her retirement .
In July 1986 windsurfers shocked the sailing world with the news that a board had travelled at the astonishing speed of 38.86 knots which is nearly 44 mph .
` I suppose I like to shock people with the power of illusion " .

Sakata management , having shocked Kershaw with the sudden announcement of a redundancy plan , are considering recalling all their new Glory models for modifications to the computerized route-finder .
I once shocked him by admitting that I sometimes took it in my tea .
I hope I did n't shock your customers by barging in so unceremoniously .
TV MAGICIAN Paul Daniels has shocked his fans by claiming Jesus 's miracles were just magic tricks which he himself can perform .
Shock everyone by doing something unconventional today .
A fierce aunt shocked me by telling me shyness is a form of rudeness and selfishness , and that I had to be the first to talk to two people .
Is it still possible to shock audiences at dance performances ?
Five top players shocked their province by upping sticks and setting sail for Japan .
It shocked me in the same way as Room at the Top shocked me when I read it last year .
Have you shocked them in the village ?
The observation shocked the world into action and convinced scientists and governments alike that ozone depletion was a serious problem .
She wanted to surprise him , shock him out of his complacency .
At the time it shocked me to the core .
This is an unpleasant discovery which may shock you into giving up and returning to the relative comfort of Stage 1 .
Jane often tried to shock her mother into facing some of the world 's uglier problems , but Laura did not react in the way Jane might have expected .
Then the two of you pitched up together in Zimbabwe , and it shocked me into facing realities .
They shocked the country , they shocked the world .
This rigidity shocked the ecumenicals .
The coolness of the caves shocked her , as did the immenseness of the place .
The hatred in her voice had shocked him .
His appearance shocked me .
I tell you , she even shocked me . "
The news shocked his thousands of admirers .
Have they shocked you ?
This is very useful , if you really want to shock yourself .
She was shocked by how much she did n't care .
The others pretended it was their job not to be shocked by what you did before they brought you here , but he never pretended .
He was shocked by what had happened and genuinely sorry for Blyth and his parents .
Her neighbours have been shocked by the accident .
My mum and dad were very shocked by the incident . "
The young men were shocked .
The adverts are designed to shock abusers and make parents more aware of the dangers .
This unprecedented catastrophe shocked the Empire profoundly .
It shocked Enrique to see her so vulnerable .
It is the book that every literate member of my family will get for Christmas , both for the fun of it , and so they can shock their humanist friends with some real news about human nature .
That had shocked me until I heard it too often to remain shocked .
Some of the Metropolitan and other English detectives on transfer from the mainland shocked the straight-laced policemen of the RUC by their slick shortcuts .
` Am I shocked by this decision ?
` We were always trying to be creative and to shock ! "
Though the dissolve has become part of film punctuation it can still shock or seduce the viewer .
Meanwhile villagers say they 're shocked by the news the nuns are to go .
